Cannon Falls is located in the scenic Cannon Valley, at the junction of the Big and Little Cannon Rivers. It is also the resting place of Colonel William J. Colvill, a hero of the Battle of Gettysburg.
Cannon Falls, Minnesota is located on Highway 52 just 35 miles south of Saint Paul/Minneapolis and 40 miles north of Rochester.

Cannon Falls is 4 square miles and has the convenience of public transportation on demand, through Hiawatha Transit Bus service.  Due to its small size, however, it is a very walk-able and friendly community.

content=The Cannon Falls Historical Museum opened in 1979 in the historic old Fireman Hall. Many interesting displays in this museum depict the past of Cannon Falls. Walk through our downtown and look for signs that tell of many, early twentieth century brick buildings that replaced the originals destroyed in a fire.

content=The Cannon Valley Trail runs through a diverse and spectacular scenery on a former Chicago Great Western Railroad line. Connecting Cannon Falls, Welch and Red Wing, the trail is for hiking, biking and cross country skiing, with no motorized vehicles allowed.
, The Cannon River Falls are located right in downtown Cannon Falls. A nice walking trail and duck pond complete the dynamic vista.
